folder: Amboy Road & Great Kills Road, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Great Kills Road
text:
3879 Amboy Road, north side, between Great Kills Road and Giffords Lane, showing "Romeo's Famous Old Gifford Inn." It was formerly known as the Wedemeyer Hotel (1917) and prior to that, the "O1d Gifford Inn" (1907). In 1898 it was the home of J.W. Hetherington. Beers' 1874 map refers to it as the Gifford House, then occupied by G. Kent.

May 6, 1930
P.L. Sperr.

folder: Amboy Road & Great Kills Road, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Great Kills Road
text:
3833 Amboy Road, at the N.W. corner of Great Eills Road. This house was occupied by Charles Walter Jr. (1907) and earlier (1898) by Cole. It was the A. Sharrott home in 1874. The dates refer to maps on which the owners' names appear.

May 17, 1932
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Amboy Road & Great Kills Road, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Great Kills Road
text:
3841 Amboy Road, west of the N.W. corner of Great Kills Road. This house belonged to M.R. and S.A. Lewis (1907), to Mary E. Lewis (1898), and to J. Lewis (1874). The dates refer to maps on which the owners' names appear.

May 17,1932
P. L. Sperr
